name: The Jerk Store Called... Quiz | Food & Drink | 10 Questions

questions.text: Jamaican jerk spice has two main ingredients; one of them being a spice that is called "pimento" in Jamaica.  It is also called the Jamaica pepper, kurundu, and myrtle pepper.  What spice is this?
questions.explanation:
Allspice.

	Allspice is made up of the dried berries of the plant Pimenta dioica.  Some think allspice tastes like a combination of cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves.

questions.text: Jamaican jerk spice uses a very hot pepper to give it flavor.  In fact, this pepper is rated around 100,000-350,000 on the Scoville scale.  What pepper gives Jamaican jerk its spicy flavor?
questions.explanation:
Scotch bonnet.

	The Scotch bonnet is one of the hottest peppers, with a Scoville rating up to 350,000.  This is very hot, considering a jalapeno rates roughly 2,500.  The infinity chili was the world's hottest pepper at 1,067,286, but not for long.  The Naga Viper pepper took the title of the world's hottest pepper on February 25, 2011, with a heat rating of 1,382,118. The three hottest peppers (infinity chili, ghost pepper, and Naga Viper) are so hot that the spice of the peppers will stay with you for life.

questions.text: This spice is usually used whole or ground, but has a very strong flavor, so it isn't used in large quantities.  In Mexican cooking, this spice is often paired with cinnamon and cumin.  What spice is this?
questions.explanation:
Clove.

	Clove is very strong in flavor, so not much is used in most seasonings.  Whole cloves are often used to make a sauce or to flavor chicken by poking dried cloves into an orange peel.  When cooked with meats or to make a sauce, the cloves in the orange peel give it a very rich and strong flavor.

questions.text: Sticks of this spice are often called "quills".  These quills can be ground to give hot chocolate a nice flavor, or to make snickerdoodles.  What spice is this?
questions.explanation:
Cinnamon.

	Cinnamon is actually made from the inner bark of trees from the Cinnamomum genus.  Cinnamon can be used for both sweet and savory dishes, such as cinnamon raisin toast or to add a slight sweetness to a bowl of chili.  Cinnamon can also bring a hot and spicy element to many things, such as candy.

questions.text: Green onions are also used in the making of Jamaican jerk spice.  By what other name are green onions known?
questions.explanation:
Scallions.

	Scallions and green onions are quite the same, though my uncle would tell you otherwise.  Scallions are similar to chives, with a long, oniony stalk with a small onion bulb at the bottom, like most onions.  They have a very mild onion flavor, not as strong as many other onions.  Scallions can also be the young onions from many other onion types that are not fully developed.

questions.text: This spice comes from the same plant as mace.  It can be used ground or whole.  When it is purchased whole, it is often ground, or zested, onto or into many dishes, such as on top of egg nog.  It is similar in appearance to a small walnut.  What spice is this?
questions.explanation:
Nutmeg.

	Nutmeg is from the Myristica genus of plants.  Both nutmeg and mace can be made from the plant.  Nutmeg is the fruit of the plant, which resembles a small walnut.  Mace is made from the leaves of the plant.

questions.text: This herb has many different varieties, such as the lemon, orange, and silver varieties.  This herb has a wonderful flavor, but it is not too overpowering, so it can be used in larger quantities.  What herb is this?
questions.explanation:
Thyme.

	Thyme is an herb that can be used to flavor almost any savory dish.  It does not have a strong flavor, but it is quite tasty.  It is not one of those herbs you have to be careful with; too much thyme won't spoil the whole meal, unlike many herbs, such as rosemary, might do.

questions.text: This spice might keep vampires away, but it is delicious in Jamaican jerk spice.  It is a relative of the onion, but it has a very different flavor.  Some people like to eat this raw or roasted, others like it in a buttery spread put on bread to eat with spaghetti.  What spice is this?
questions.explanation:
Garlic.

	Garlic is a very common spice that can be used in just about any savory dish, and even some sweet dishes.  Garlic is often said to keep vampires away, so some people have a lei of dried garlic in their kitchen.  Garlic has a very strong flavor, and can leave the breath smelling bad, and some people even sweat a garlicy smell, so oftentimes garlic is used sparingly.

questions.text: Of course, no seasoning is complete without these two very common spices, used in almost every savory dish.  What are these two extremely common spices, which you can find in shakers at many restaurants?
questions.explanation:
Salt and pepper.

	Jamaican jerk spice is not complete without salt and pepper.  Most spice mixtures include at least some salt and pepper, which are perhaps the two most commonly used spices is many different cuisines.  They are usually the cheapest spices, and give good flavors to any dish; making them some of the most-used spices.

questions.text: Jamaican jerk spice is delicious in itself, but the method of cooking the meats with the spice also gives it a distinct flavor.  What is the prefered method to cook Jamaican jerk?
questions.explanation:
Grilled over charcoal.

	Jamaican jerk spice is best grilled in a jerk pan over hardwood charcoal.  To give it even more flavor, the berries, leaves, and wood of the allspice plant is put among the coals.  The flavor of the allspice plant penetrates through the meat itself, giving the meat a flavor throughout, as opposed to simply a layer of spice on the meat.
